conclusion: Analyzing the heat exchange in the cyclic process A→B→C→D→A for the ideal gas.
A cyclic process with 4 states (A, B, C, D) connected by paths; y-axis represents pressure (p) in units of 10⁵ Pa; x-axis represents volume ratio (V/L).
A→B is an isobaric (constant pressure) expansion.
B→C is an isochoric (constant volume) cooling.
For an ideal gas, the first law of thermodynamics states: Q = ΔU + W.
ΔU is change in internal energy = nCvΔT for an ideal gas; W is work done by the gas = ∫p dV.
For process A→B, TB = TA·(VB/VA) = 300K·(4/3) = 400K using ideal gas law.
QAB = nCp(TB - TA) = nCp(400K - 300K) = 100nCp for process A→B.
For process B→C, TC = TB·(pC/pB) = 400K·0.75 = 300K using ideal gas law.
QBC = nCv(TC - TB) = nCv(300K - 400K) = -100nCv for process B→C.
For process C→D, TD = TC·(VD/VC) = 300K·0.75 = 225K using ideal gas law.
QCD = nCp(TD - TC) = nCp(225K - 300K) = -75nCp for process C→D.
